definition: rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders

sentences.english: Love really need courage to face the tattle and prate.
sentences.chinese: 爱真的需要勇气，来面对流言蜚语。

sentences.english: He doesn't care about scandals, slanders, calumnies, aspersions, or defamation.
sentences.chinese: 他不在乎流言蜚语，诽谤，中伤。

sentences.english: Even just passing gossip and hearsay can prime your mind for illness with potent effect.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕只传传流言蜚语和道听途说都能灌输强烈影响。

sentences.english: But there is more to me than just a tabloid girl.
sentences.chinese: 但是总有一些很过分的流言蜚语加诸在我身上。

sentences.english: The circulation of gossip is vicious.
sentences.chinese: 传播流言蜚语是可恶的。

sentences.english: THE GIST Gossiping can be beneficial.
Disordered nerves and bad digestion are a common cause of backbiting.
sentences.chinese: 神经过敏和承担力差是生成流言蜚语的常见原因。

sentences.english: He discredited my good name with gossip.
sentences.chinese: 他用流言蜚语败坏我的好名声。

sentences.english: He was bespattered by malicious gossip .
sentences.chinese: 流言蜚语者恶毒的舌头。

sentences.english: She discredited him with ugly gossip.
sentences.chinese: 她用难听的流言蜚语臭他。

sentences.english: Discourage gossip, and don't put people in the position of spying or reporting on each other.
sentences.chinese: 制止流言蜚语，不要让人做卧底或者打小报告。

sentences.english: The Palace won't like all this gossip.
sentences.chinese: 国王不会喜欢这些流言蜚语的。

sentences.english: He scattered imputations at large against my reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他到处散布流言蜚语，毁坏我的名声。

sentences.english: The rumors and slanders is negligible to me.
sentences.chinese: 流言蜚语对于我来说是可以忽略的。

definition: to spread malicious gossip/also written 飛短流長|飞短流长[fei1 duan3 liu2 chang2]
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
